title: Old-age dependency ratio by state and union territory in India 2011
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
The Old-age dependency ratio is highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The highest State And Union Territory Kerala has 9.2 more Old-age dependency ratio than the lowest State And Union Territory Delhi.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
State And Union Territory Kerala has the highest Old-age dependency ratio and Delhi has the lowest Old-age dependency ratio.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Old-age dependency ratio for 20 number of State And Union Territorys.
The Old-age dependency ratio is highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
The highest State And Union Territory Kerala has 9.2 more Old-age dependency ratio than the lowest State And Union Territory Delhi.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
Second maximum Old-age dependency ratio is found at State And Union Territory Punjab.
The difference of Old-age dependency ratio between the highest and lowest State And Union Territory is 9.2.
Old-age dependency ratio at State And Union Territory Kerala is 19.6 , second place is Punjab at 16.1, and thirdly is Tamil Nadu at 15.8.
Similar Old-age dependency ratio is found in State And Union Territory Andaman & Nicobar Islands, and Odisha.
The State And Union Territory Delhi has 1.39 times less Old-age dependency ratio than average.
